title: Geraldo Rivera Irked Over Trump Administration’s Target On Marijuana
text:
Trump Promises Military Buildup To Send A Global Message 
Spicer said President Donald Trump believes there is “a big difference” between marijuana use for medical purposes and for enjoyment. 
“The president understands the pain and suffering that many people go through who are facing, especially terminal diseases, and the comfort that some of these drugs, including medical marijuana, can bring to them,” Spicer said. 
“When you see something like the opioid addiction crisis blossoming in so many states around this country, the last thing we should be doing is encouraging people,” Spicer said. “There is still a federal law that we need to abide by when it comes to recreational marijuana and drugs of that nature.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Rivera did not care for what he heard, and questioned why the Trump administration would allow states to make a decision on a subject such as bathroom access for transgendered school students but not on marijuana. If @realDonaldTrump #POTUS has decided #Transgender bathrooms are a #StatesRights issue Why isn't #Marijuana legalization also up to states? 
— Geraldo Rivera (@GeraldoRivera) February 23, 2017 #Feds will clash w local & state govts on #immigration & #Marijuana but happily surrender on social issues #transgenderbathrooms & #abortion 
— Geraldo Rivera (@GeraldoRivera) February 24, 2017 
Rivera also noted that in many states, marijuana legalization is so well advanced that opposing it would be difficult. Advertisement - story continues below
